sentence.text: The newly reported myoclonus-dystonia gene, cell morphogenesis involved in differentiation, plays also a role in the formation of brain structures.

Defects in neurodevelopment likewise seem to be a recurrent scheme underpinning mainly complex dystonias, for example those attributable to biallelic mutations in tetrahydrobiopterin biosynthetic process, TH, SPR, or to heterozygous TUBB4A mutations.
The novel myoclonus-dystonia genes endoplasmic reticulum calcium ion homeostasis and CACNA1B also implicate abnormal calcium signaling in dystonia.
This includes the first two genes linked to recessively inherited isolated dystonia, that is, HPCA (hippocalcin) and muscle organ development (collagen VI alpha 3).
